My first time here and my first-ever jibarito. The twin mini-sandwiches (I had expected one larger sandwich) were tasty enough, but messy to deal with -- the fresh tomato and lettuce and the unneeded garlic mayonnaise instantly wilted on contact with the hot meat, producing major drippage. BTW this was not one or two slices of steak, as I had imagined, but a handful of tiny meat pieces -- OK I suppose. 

I was less pleased with the other items. Normally I LOVE maduros -- delicate pillows of sweet fried goodness. These were underripe and very dark, as if they were cooked in bad oil, or too long, or both. Yellow rice was dry and sticky. My shrimp empanada had a good flavor but, again, was dark brown instead of golden brown. 

This is counter service cooked to order -- not fast food -- so don't go in a big hurry.

Prices are reasonable. Staff were friendly. The music wasn't painfully loud, but loud enough that I couldn't quite hear what they were saying. 

PS while the address listed is correct, don't go by the map that pops up when you click on Yelp's direction link. They are a block east of the 18th St Pink Line stop, NOT down by the river -- very misleading!
Everything is amazing!!! I love love love the shrimp empanadas. I over indulge every single time!

YUM YUM YUM!!!! I love this place. Been here three times and have not been disappointed. My only complaint is that it takes a while for them to prepare my meal, but that's because they make it fresh-to-order. Planning on making my fourth trip back soon!!! :)

First time customer and now I'm a loyal customer.this place has Humboldt park beat hands down.not the typical restaurant with paintings of the island but the photos the have capture the heart and soul of the Puerto Rican people

Food was tasty but overpriced! I walked in and sat down and didn't notice the tiny ORDER HERE sign propped by the register  I finally made my way over to the register after several minutes of making eye contact with the the person taking orders. She never bothered greeting us or at the least mention how we needed to place our order up front. Maybe she was having a bad day?!

I came here the other day with my friends and ordered a steak jibarrito.  It was our first time at this place. The garlic topping was amazing like no other, and we literally savored every bite. Best I've had so far. The service is pretty fast. The prices are reasonable.

Haven't ate yet.... Taking long time for food to come.  Negative reviews for service thou!  Employee In a terrible mood just screamed at me and my daughter because we didn't see restroom light outside of the restroom!!!   Never again
Sooooooo good! Every mouthful was so flavorful. Do yourself a favor and EAT HERE! YUMMY!
The steak jibarito sandwich with queso chihuahua is the best, the shrimp empanadas and the platano maduro.

what can I say! the best Puerto Rican food by far! It taste authentic and home cooked!  We are a fan of the " steak jibaritos"! perfectly seasoned! Its like a having a piece of the island ( Puerto Rico) in the heart of Pilsen !
Nice having Puerto Rican food near South. The food was great. I had a jibarito with rice. Portions are good, food was flavorful. Wishing they had more seating space :)

This place is phenomenal!  I often work nearby and I order take out whenever possible.  The plantains are perfect. The steak sandwich is their best menu item.  Perfectly cooked in garlic and onions and put in the middle of plantain patties.  You simply cannot go wrong with anything on the menu at Jibarito Stop.

Best Jibaritos in town. Only in Chicago! 18st spot. Better than Humbolt Park. Hands down. I've had Papa's Cache, el borinque to several other in humbolt park but no not like this Jobarito Stop. Hands down!!!.best green garlic sauce ever. Dont forget to ask. The restaurant smell good and friendly atmosphere. Love it!, I'll be coming back soon.

Meh. 

I was never a fan of the food truck. After trying it twice I'd come to the conclusion that it was just over-salted latin-inspired and not authentic. When they opened the restaurant I was hoping that having a proper kitchen and the food being cooked to order would make a difference. I decided to try it out again when they first opened. After waiting 20 minutes in line during my lunch hour they announced that they'd ran out of steak. I left without ordering.

I was in the area today and decided to go back. Overall, I'll pass. There was no line so I was excited. Ordered the steak jibarito with white rice and beans. After getting my food, I was surprised it was served on a paper plate, but I thought "ok-they just opened". After digging into my food I was immediately regretful. The rice and beans were good, but I couldn't really enjoy because it was extremely salty. The jibarito was a generous size, but was lackluster at best. The steak had no flavor. Highlight of my meal was the Cola Champagne I ordered.

I'm Puerto Rican so I was definitely looking forward to the food since its in my area. Sadly, Puerto Rican restaurants think because they put steak on a plantain it'll be a jibarito. Not so much. Flavor is a huge part. Won't be back, won't be recommending.

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! It's super chill so if you're expecting table service you came to the wrong spot. You order up front and then they bring you the food to your table but anything you need you get up and get yourself. The food is so delicious! Best of all, it's close to home so it saves me driving to the north side for Puerto Rican food. Give it a try, you'll love it!
Great puertoRican food nice n Friendly people love this place you have to go And try this place out you won't regretted ...
Order the steak Jibarito sandwich with arroz con grandules. I promise you, it's ahhhhhmazing. Great staff too!

There were 3 of us and none of us were disappointed. All the food was delicious! We had the pork platter, jibarito steak sandwich, beef empanadas, alcapurria, and arroz con gandulas. DELICIOUS! Not a fancy restaurant but who cares because the food is excellent!

So delicious! My favorite is the slow roasted pork jibarito. The meat is soft and well seasoned, the orange sauce (flavored mayo?) is creamy and cooling, and the plantain buns are always crispy and brushed with an amazing garlic oil. The beans and rice is AMAZING. Seriously my favorite thing there. Cream cheese flan in the fridge also gets a shout out. You won't be disappointed if you go here!
Best jibarito I've had. That garlic oil they use on the plantain is bomb. Great place.

It's a relief that I don't have to travel all the way up north for a tasty jibarito.  The meat was coked just right and the plantain was crunchy and not oily.  It comes with your choice of white or yellow rice.  I chose the yellow and it was mist and fluffy.  I certainly hope that this place stays.  Will definitely go again.

I absolutely love every time I come into this restaurant growing up in the Puerto Rican household I've always appreciated the mini great Puerto Rican food I was born and raised in New York and now I live in Chicago and I never imagined that I would find a place to call home I love everything from the empanadas jibarito sandwiches and mofongos & maduros if you ever in the Pilsen neighborhood in Chicago stopping and try the bass authentic Puerto Rican food in Chicago and make sure you have a horchata
Love this spot.  Best Puerto Rican food this side of San Juan.  Also the ladies who run this place are seriously hot mamacitas.  ;) Ai Bendito!
Loved the rice and beans, not a big fan of the jibarito just wanted to try this location but it didn't win me over, great service and environment though. Like the chalkboard on the wall and the music

Authentic, incredible flavors, taste even better than my Abuela's cooking! GREAT LOW PRICES. Empandas and lechon jibaritos are addictive. Potatoe salad is excellent. We would follow the food truck around town so glad they finally have a store front which is always kept clean!
Puerto Rican joint on the South Side? What? Where have you been, this place is awesome and has a great Jibarito.
This food is so damn good I want to move next door.  The Empanada Shrimp are serious business.  Plantains are silky moist and the sauce is fire.
I was looking for a spot on the south side for puerto Rican food and I'm glad I found this spot!!! It's jibaritos and empanadas are delicious!!! You won't be disappointed.
They have amazing alcapurias. The Jabarito is good I tried the steak. It comes with puetorican rice or white rice.
The Jibarito here was excellent. I loved it, and would certainly come again. Highly recommended.

This was one of my favorite food trucks but as of last fall they've opened a brick and mortar restaurant in the Pilsen neighborhood...the perfect success story of how a person can start out with a food truck and grow their business into a restaurant. The food is always delicious and the service is great!

So happy that there's now a Puerto Rican restaurant close by me! Little upset that they don't deliver to me seeing as though I'm barely a mile away but no problem. It was only an 8minute drive. The food is delicious though! I ordered a steak jibarito. The flavor hits you all at once. I will definitely be ordering here again.

El Jibarito was fantastic! This is definitely a no frills place, but delicious and not pricey. It was my first time here. Granted, I'm a fan of all types of hispanic food, but omg the empanadas were delicious. I think the beef and cheese was better than the shrimp, but both were delicious. I also had the white rice with beans and mixed in some tapa tio sauce and chipotle mayo to spice it up. The shrimp empanada was listed as spicy, but I felt that it could have had a bit more flavor... All in all, definitely a place to try out if you are a fan of delicious food, good prices, and don't mind no frills. :)

So glad I stopped in and tried the Jibarito! My 1 year old son danced to the music while he enjoyed his papa rellena! *Suggestion: I know PR food doesn't use a lot heat but if you're gonna add a PR spot to Pilsen, offer some type spice besides Valentina hot sauce.  Cafe Central offers a simple jalapeno salsa, something similar would be great! I'll be back really soon!

You get a lot (and very good) food for the money. For less than $20 (including tip), we got a pork jibarito with white rice and beans, and an empanada basket with arroz con gandules. Everything was delicious and well seasoned. The surprise was the white rice and beans; it was so good, I could have just eaten the white rice alone.
Great place for Jibaritos. The plantain seasonings were very tasty. Prices are very reasonable.
Love the food !! I love the slow roasted pork jibarito. My favorite are the Maduros  amazing food and service.

I came in today w my mom & we were both so satisfied! i'm glad that the original place we were going to was closed because we found this gem! I usually am not one to eat a jibarito & was just going to sub out for bread, but i'm actually happy that wasn't an option. I enjoyed my jibarito soooooo much, so did my mom. we loved that the platano wasn't super thick (which is why I usually steer away from getting it) & it was able to get crunchy. I love garlic, so the flavors were so good! I also had the carne y queso empanadas & loved those also, I have one to take home & enjoy later. the staff was very friendly. I just wish this place was closer to me!!!

First experience was seeing the food truck by chance over by the Merchandise Mart. Was so excited to find them on Grubhub, we've ordered 3 times in less than 2 weeks! Had to call in one time because I goofed our order,  the lady on the phone was very helpful and super accommodating with the addition to the order.  Going into the restaurant tomorrow for lunch! The food has great flavor and the portions are generous (island-style! ) , so glad they're here and open in Pilsen. This is just what Pilsen/South Loop needed!
Everything I had here was great. Jibarito steak sandwich, rice, and the sweet plantains

This is the first time I have ordered from this location for delivery; I have been to the actual restaurant and it is a nice establishment. I do love their empanadas; they are good as usual. This time I tried the chicken breast jibarito with yellow rice and it was amazing (and this is my first time trying a chicken jibarito lol). Next time I will definitely try their steak jibaritos. Overall great food!

This was my first time here and i have to say everything was awesome, i had the Jibarito sandwich bistec, it was so good the meat was very tender, and the plantains were cook just right, with lots of garlic butter, my hands still smell like garlic, i also had the white beans and rice, you get rice on your plate and a cup of beans with the delicious sauce that you pour over your rice it was heavenly tasty, and then i had Papa Rellena, this is a stuffed potato ball with meat inside the flavors were just bursting out with each bite, i also tried Alcapurria, a Yuca fritter, OMG the flavors i tasted were fanominal, i could have made a meal out of these alone, so to sum it up i will definitely be going back to try the Shrimp Empanadas and more, if your ever in the neighborhood give the Jibarito Stop a try, you to will say, ill be back

Really good empanadas! The rice is on point also  the prices are kinda high to if you are going with a like 3 people expect to spend about $60+ in order to try everything from the menu. I suggest get a little bit of everything also the sauce for the empanadas is made there and it's really good. The plantains are amazing also! This is a great place for Pilsen and the location is perfect very casual place and good vibes always!

For jibaritos I travel to the northside, but once I saw this place I thought no more traveling to the northside yay! I finally tried their jibarito, I ordered the steak with Arroz con gandules. The place is nice, small, clean, tables are kinda sticky but I'm assuming because of the coat of paint on it which is kinda weird. You order at the counter and they bring the food out to you also you take your drink with you when you order, they won't bring it to you. Service was okay. The food was good but I hate to say the plantain was soggy and not crunchy, the meat was good with overflowing juices, the rice was ok I've had better. This place is good but not great. I think I'll continue going to the northside for the quality of food.

I loved loved the place is so close to home we needed some Puerto Rican food around... Service was beyond excellent and jibarito very filling and so good! I wish they can add more variation to the menu and they will get my 5 stars

Decent enough to eat it all, but bland enough to complain about eating it all. We shared one steak and one chicken sandwich. Those were pretty good, but like I said, hella bland. It needed some spice or something. Ingredients seemed of good quality but it was the flavor that was lacking. Also, the shrimp empanada for $3 was alright, not worth it. Don't get me wrong, I did enjoy the meal, I just wish it was a little bit better.

Have been craving Puerto Rican food lately and came across this place on grubhub. Decided to give it a try. I ordered the steak jibarito that came with Arroz con gandules, and i aslo ordered a beef empanada, and a side of mayo ketchup. Order came with in 25-30 minutes. I completely loved it! Will definitely be ordering from here more often !
Love at first bite!The Jibarito sandwich with steak so good!!! The steak so tender and well flavored. soft crunchy plantain.Arroz con gondules were a hit.I see me coming here a couple time a week.

Foodgasm! BEST shrimp empanadas EVER!! I really hope they bring back the chicken empanadas :( Those were amazing as well. Delicious sauce to accompany the empanadas. Jibarito is ok. Arroz con gandules have a ton of flavor. Definitely try the shrimp empanadas!!!

This is a great spot if you want to eat delicious Puerto  Rican food. The staff are super nice and helpful. We had the steak jibarito as well as the pork jibarito with an appetizer of empanadas.  You can't go wrong with anything in their menu. Awesome food and great service. We will be back!!!!!

Me and my sister have been driving all the way to borinquen for years to get our jibarito fix and now we are so thrilled to welcome this tasty Puerto Rican gem into our hood! Gracias dios santo for this delicious food! My sisters client Adolfo said that his sister opened up this place in Pilsen and that we should try it. We did today and we are so glad we did. The jibaritos are DELICIOUS! I will mention the girl who took my phone order seemed a little bit scattered and when I arrived they realized they gave my order to someone else so I had to wait a little bit. But Alex was very apologetic and even threw in a papa rellena for me to try on the house! Great customer service. I will most definitely return. Welcome to the neighborhood hermanos!

The steak Jibarito sandwich was excellent.  I had heard it was good, but was surprised how good it really was.   Loved the garlic on the plantain and the steak was tender.   Also had the rice and pigeon peas and thought that was good too.   Can't wait to go back.

Fellow food critic and NATIVE here.  
I went in around the afternoon midday to introduce myself as the food critic,in the afternoon and was pretty much brushed off by a woman with a dark ponytail.  But I didn't let the rude wait staff deter me.  I ordered the empañada basket, which was a total of close to $10. I was handed a small container of rice and 2 small empañadas, the empañadas were freshly hot and pretty good.  But The arroz con granules was a bit under cooked. For 10$.. 

I mean, picture this..  Your whole life, you've known arroz con grandules to be well seasoned Moist and al dente.  Picture shattered! I asked the cook about the rice and he literally sucked his teeth and sighed. I understand, you probably worked incredibly hard on the rice.  And it still didn't turn out the way, intended.  I wasn't offering a whole new order to replace it.  

While the wait time was just about 12 mins, (which was totally fine because, I needed time gather myself and eat before heading to a meeting) The scenery of the lobby was dimly lit and had some pretty good room for seating.  Not exactly a full house in the afternoon where in lunch..  Most of the strip is crawling with people.  But this was full only by the definition of just 2 small tables that were full. I'd says it's intimate enough if you're looking for a window view.  
Detail by scenery: the windows weren't clean,and the floor looked like it hadn't been swepted or mopped.  And when I inquired about a restroom the cook in the back ( a younger short dark haired man) looked directly passed me. All of 25mins of being in this place, not only did I feel unwelcome.  Nothing says unwelcome than paying $10 for under cooked food and wait staff who don't know how to use their words. 
Now.. To my understanding, it took the owners (2 Latinas from the other side of the city) a hot minute to get the establishment up. That's neither here nor there.  Because What's absolutely unacceptable is, the attitude of their wait staff and the very lack of cleanliness..  
If the crowd dies down or is just slow paced kinda day, you'll have walk the time in the world to catch up on simple spot cleaning.  

Here's a tip: 
we Southsiders are prettttty forgiving in these cases.  Yes, there's a plethora of problems that are totally common in restaurants, however that doesn't absolve you of a responsibility that you owed, to the general public. While There's much potential to grow here and there's room for everyone.  Let's be real, it can get really lonely during those winter hours, having a so uno customers, and last time I checked.  Having only 2 full tables out such a generous space isn't for exactly "making it" ..  So if you want our services, act right.  Train your staff and check your condescending attitudes and entitlement before you come to work.  This is literally how you lose customers regardless of how far they travel to come to frequent your space.  Lastly, CLEAN YOUR STORE!

This place is horrible. The pork was dry they barley put any in the platter it was more rice then anything. When I relieved it three grub hub the grease was spilled everywhere. The only park that was good was the one piece of skin I got on the pork platter. Will not be going here and I will make sure I tell people it's horrible.

Living in Pilsen, I heard of this place a million times. I had to try it. I ordered a steak jabarito to go. They were really nice people and the food was amazing. I don't just through around five stars... I think they were that  great. The cooks looked a little grumpy, lol, buy hey... that's fine. They make amazing food, you can be grumpy:)  I highly recommend them.

The Jibarito Stop just opened up a new restaurant a few blocks from my work, and I couldn't be more excited.  Always on the lookout for new lunch places and eager to support new local businesses, myself and the rest of the folks in my office decided to order take out and give it a go.  The reviews were unanimous... the food was delicious.  Given that the name of the restaurant is the Jibarito Stop, I figured I had no choice but to try a Jibarito.  I was a little skeptical on the combination of ingredients (not being a huge plantain fan), but figured "when in Rome!".  I couldn't have been happier with my choice.  I chose a Steak Jibarito, which comes with a big ol' serving of arroz con gandules (rice with pigeon peas).  The steak was wonderfully seasoned, and the plantain "bun" gave it just the right flavor.  Very happy to see such a great addition to the neighborhood and looking forward to trying some more items from the menu!

This food was amazing, so much so that I had to write a yelp review!  The veggie jibarito rocked my world and even the white rice and beans were well seasoned.  I want to come back!  My only complaint was the styrofoam cups and plastic utensils.

I am very disappointed in myself.  I thought I had given The Jibarito Stop their 5 star reviews ages ago!  
I started off frequenting The Jibarito Stop when they were a food truck in the Loop.  They have, hands down, the best beef and cheese empanadas. Now that their store front is open in Pilsen, The Jibarito Stop is finally able to serve their name sake sandwich.  My go to is the steak jibarito. It is piled with tender, flavorful steak and topped with your choice of cheese.  You cannot go wrong with this classic.  I have my husband stop in every 6 weeks on his way home from getting a hair cut near Bridgeport.  The food is so good I don't even care that it is usual cold by the time I make it home from work. I don't think there is much higher praise than still good when room temp!  
So trust me, go get a jibarito and some beef empanadas and if there is flan available, grab that too.  You can thank me when you wake from your food coma
Not the best puerto rican food. Since its the only one on the south side it will do. Being puerto rican i suggest to use fresh made sofrito its lacking the flavor.
Great food! The steak jibarito is amazing! Staff is always friendly and food comes out hot and fast! A great addition to 18th street eateries.

Been here quite a few times, the food is fantastic and affordable, best Jibarito in town IMHO. I usually get the pork with pepperjack cheese, with the beans and white rice.  Also get the flan, delicious!

What a great restaurant! I discovered this place on Grubhub and it was great. There aren't a lot of Puerto Rican restaurants in the South Loop/Pilsen and this place is a godsend. I had the steak jibarito which was delicious. It came with yummy yellow rice with peas. The empanadas are unbelievable. You have to order them. They're huge! We also had the fried plantains (rostones) and they were great too. There just weren't alot of them. Lastly, we had the whipped potatoes as a side. I was surprised because they were COLD. I think that is how they are supposed to be served but I wasn't expecting it.other than that, this place is a very value and I'll be back!
